description: Clump template management - reusable clump definitions for efficient clump generation
note: Templates define clump geometries that can be instantiated multiple times. They store pebble configurations and inertial properties.

functions.name: count
functions.description: Get total number of clump templates. O(1) operation - very fast.

returns.description: Number of clump templates currently defined

functions.name: find
functions.description: Find a clump template by name. Returns None if template doesn't exist.

parameters.name: template_name
parameters.description: Name of the template to search for

returns.description: Template object if found, None if name doesn't exist

functions.name: findpebble
functions.description: Find the clump template pebble with the given ID, in the clump template.

parameters.name: pebble_id
parameters.description: ID of the template pebble to search for

returns.description: TemplatePebble object if found, None if ID doesn't exist

functions.name: list
functions.description: Return an iterator over all clump templates. Returns iterator (not list). Order not guaranteed.

functions.name: make
functions.description: Make a clump template from a clump. No clumps refer to the created clump template. Useful for saving clump configurations for reuse.

parameters.name: clump_template
parameters.description: Source clump template to copy from

functions.name: maxid
functions.description: Get the maximum clump template ID currently defined.
